labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.5-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/79098 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** iPhone 15 iOS 26.1 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Preconditions: log in as User A on the secondary device, as User B on iOS 1. As User A, create a workspace 2. User A, navigate to the workspace chat, mention User B and select "Invite to chat only" on the whisper message 3. As User B, navigate to the User A's workspace chat 4. As User A, create an expense in the workspace chat 5. As User B, tap on the report preview to open the details ## Expected Result: User B is able to open the expense report from the first try ## Actual Result: When User B opens the report from User A for the first time, it shows skeleton loading, then User B is dropped back in the workspace chat ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/567732cc-d7ce-4a91-af19-599a33d6de8d [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [CFI] Approved! - Add the ability to create a workspace for a client.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Issue reported by:** @trjExpensify **Slack conversation**: [#migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1768420932833249?thread_ts=1768418199.405579&cid=C07NMDKEFMH) ## Action Performed: 1. Set an account as an Approved! Accountant, such that `isApprovedAccountant: true` 2. Go to Workspaces > Click "New workspace" ## Expected Result: This is a Classic feature we're bringing over to NewDot, that's available only for accounts that are marked as Approved! Accountants. In the "Confirm workspace" modal: 1. Show the `Plan type` row to access the plan type selector. - Default the value to `Control` if the user is a member of any Control workspaces. Else, default to `Collect`. 2. Show the `Owner` row to access the standard participant selector (Recents, Contacts etc) - Default to the account taking the action to create a new workspace - Whichever account gets selected here should be made the owner of the workspace upon creation. 3. Show the "Keep me as an admin" toggle when they select an owner other than themself. - The toggle should be enabled by default when shown. - This controls setting `makeMeAdmin: true || false` to keep the creator on the workspace as an admin, or not. ## Actual Result: A! accountants can't currently create workspace for their clients. ## Workaround: Switch back to Classic or create the workspace and ask the client to take over billing. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos In-line above. [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @QichenZhu

body:
1. [`src/CONST/index.ts`](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/CONST/index.ts#L7130-L7134) \- Add `TOP_CATEGORIES: 'topCategories'` to `CONST.SEARCH.SEARCH_KEYS`  
   2. [`src/languages/en.ts`](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/languages/en.ts#L6614) (and all language files) \- Add `topCategories: 'Top categories'` translation  
   3. [`src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts`](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L602-L627) \- Add `TOP_CATEGORIES` definition in `getSuggestedSearches()` with query: `type:expense group-by:category date:last-month sort-by:group-total sort-order:desc limit:10`  
   4. [`src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts`](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L635-L725) \- Add visibility logic in `getSuggestedSearchesVisibility()` to show for all accounts with at least one workspace (policy)  
   5. [`src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts`](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L2903-L2918) \- Add to Insights menu section in `createTypeMenuSections()`  
   6. Ensure that the `TransactionGroupListExpanded` component is used to render the table

title: [$250] [Insights] [Release 1] Top Categories - Add a limit filter to search

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

body:
Add a limit parameter to the search query language to limit results shown in the insights we display.

1. Add limit to parser grammar - [src/libs/SearchParser/baseRules.peggy](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/libs/SearchParser/baseRules.peggy#L53-L81) - Add limit rule similar to sortBy/sortOrder 
2. [Generate the JS code by running these scripts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/af0accbe63be8b9411b4c9892b2aa8ba9c19e99e/package.json#L75-L76)
3. Add limit to parser default values - [src/libs/SearchParser/searchParser.peggy](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/libs/SearchParser/searchParser.peggy#L45-L50), [defaultKey rule](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/libs/SearchParser/searchParser.peggy#L263) - because it’s a root level parameter; it controls query execution, not data filtering.
4. Add limit to constants - [src/CONST/index.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/CONST/index.ts#L6972-L6979) - Add LIMIT: 'limit' to CONST.SEARCH.SYNTAX_ROOT_KEYS
5. Add limit to type definitions - [src/components/Search/types.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/components/Search/types.ts#L234-L244) - Add limit?: number to SearchQueryAST type
6. Update query building functions - [src/libs/SearchQueryUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/libs/SearchQueryUtils.ts#L545-L548) - Add limit?: number to BuildQueryStringOptions type and include limit in [query string building logic](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/libs/SearchQueryUtils.ts#L574-L575)
7. Update the autocomplete parser and [filterOutRangesWithCorrectValue](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/4eb43b47a6d88114b4f9520438cb935690231e11/src/libs/SearchAutocompleteUtils.ts#L142) so that it properly highlights the limit in the user input

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @rojiphil</details>

labels.name: External

labels.name: Help Wanted

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.5-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176944/test-cases/41237733 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.7.3 Chrome **App Component:** Left Hand Navigation (LHN) ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND 2. Go offline 3. Click Start chat, add two other accounts to the group, with whom you've never interacted before 4. Click Next, then Start group 5. Send a message in the group chat 6. Create a split, select scan and upload a valid receipt 7. Refresh the page and go online 8. Wait for the scan to finish, navigate to another conversation and back to group if it takes too long 9. Observe the LHN in the Inbox ## Expected Result: Two new chats with the split participants are created and shown in LHN for the split creator ## Actual Result: The chats with the split participants do not appear in the LHN after splitting expense offline and going online. They are shown only after refreshing the page ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d0487f3b-4e9b-493c-99d4-00ce7991507b [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.3-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** N/A **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/576875 **Issue reported by:** multiple migrated customers incl. @twisterdotcom's escalation cited below **Slack conversation**: [#migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1765362343432339) ## Action Performed: 1. Go to global create > Create expense 2. Scan a receipt 3. Click on the receipt preview ## Expected Result: This is a new feature we're bringing across from Classic. 1. Add the `Rotate` `Crop` `Replace` buttons beneath the image, leaving icons for `Download` and `Delete` in the top bar: 2. When clicking `Crop`, replace the three buttons with two buttons to `Cancel` or `Save`. Reveal a draggable border around the receip preview: 3. Allow all four corners and sides of the draggable border to be dragged to crop to the desired size: 4. Clicking `Save` exits the crop mode and resizes the receipt preview accordingly (or `Cancel` to exit without any changes): ## Actual Result: This feature doesn't exist on NewDot currently. ## Workaround: Switch to Classic to use this feature. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos In-line above.
